name: alternative_names
description: Alternative name for a culture; Ethnonyms

name: People
Stella_Comments: Anna might want this to be public, check with her
Pat comments: Yes I think all Peoples columns were supposed to be public

name: People2
description: Larger cultural grouping encompassing People1. Not finalized or completed yet.
Pat comments: Yes I think all Peoples columns were supposed to be public

name: People3
Pat comments: Yes I think all Peoples columns were supposed to be public

name: Arensberglomax_clusters
description: Categories relating to a clustering analyses performed in Lomax, A. (1989). Cantometrics. In International encyclopedia of communications (1st ed., pp. 230‰ЫТ233). New York, NY: Oxford University Press.
notes: Is there a restriced set of values?
Stella_Comments: Check with Anna about restrictions, I think there should be a restricted set of values but I'm not sure, and not sure what they are.

name: Focal_years
description: Year or decade to which song and culture data pertain.

name: cantometrics_samplesize
description: The number of data points in Cantometrics for a society
Stella_Comments: Required should be FALSE. There are societies that are coded for other datasets and not canto. And a handful of societies are not coded for any dataset, they are leftover from old codes that were removed and other things, but we're keeping them (though maybe they should be internal?) Let me know if you want more detail on that.
Pat comments: "I originally had been thinking that we would publish one public version now which ONLY includesКsocieties with Cantometric codings and keep a private version thatКincludes societies with only data from non-cantometrics. But as I think about this I think it would be overly confusing. So I think best to do as Stella suggests and just publish ONE version that includes ALL societies, even those without Cantometrics. So I agree with StellaХs comments here and in the rows below."

name: minutage_samplesize
description: The number of data points in Minutage for a society
Stella_Comments: Should be public

name: parlametrics_samplesize
description: The number of data points in Parlametrics for a society
Stella_Comments: Should be public

name: phonotactics_samplesize
description: The number of data points in Phonotactics for a society
Stella_Comments: Should be public

name: Koppen_climate_terrain
description: Climate category based on Koppen-Geiger World Maps http://koeppen-geiger.vu-wien.ac.at/. Multiple categories are comma separated.

name: Koppen_code
description: Climate category code based on Koppen-Geiger World Maps http://koeppen-geiger.vu-wien.ac.at/. Multiple categories are comma separated.

name: Arensberglomax_taxon
description: Taxon allocations from Lomax, A., & Arensberg, C. M. (1977). A Worldwide Evolutionary Classification of Cultures by Subsistence Systems. Current Anthropology, 18(4), 659‰ЫТ708.
Anna comments: Require, public, if the field is blank require something like NI, no information

name: Taxon_id
description: Refined Arensberg-Lomax Culture ID, from Lomax & Arensberg (1977).
notes: structured as four letters followed by four numbers?
Stella_Comments: Structured as "scfal" followed by an integer (from 1-1276 currently). I think this should be internal for now because we don't have the data ready, and these taxon ids are a new identifier that we created to go with digitized data once we prepare it.

name: Language
description: Primary language spoken by a culture

name: Language_nearsubfamily
Stella_Comments: Required should be TRUE

name: Language_largersubfamily
Stella_Comments: Required should be TRUE

name: Language_family
description: The language family linked to a culture
Stella_Comments: Required should be TRUE

name: Language_familytree
description: The hierarchy of language families linked to a culture

name: ISO6393
description: ISO 639 is a standardized nomenclature used to classify languages
notes: Can we remove the ISO 6393 prefix? Then this column can be constrained more appropriately.
Stella_Comments: Fine with me

name: Country
description: Name of the country a culture resides in. If a culture persists across borders, countries are seperated by semi-colons.

name: Country_id
Stella_Comments: Not sure what this column was supposed to be. Check with Anna, but I would say remove it or clarify what it is and keep internal.

name: society_id
Stella_Comments: Looks like all of them except one are 5 digit numbers, but not sure if that is worth making a requirement. They come from the original Lomax documents and new ones are added sequentially.
Pat comments: Agree with Stella,  Required and public

name: EA_Prov_#

name: EA_Prov_notes

name: Culture Sources
Stella_Comments: I think this should be public? So that users can look up the source in our source database.

name: song_id
Anna comments: We have those elsewhere—we have those.  Those are CODING IDS SAM PLEASE NOTE THIS.  Maybe there should be an identifier for each song, AND a coding Id.

name: Preferred_name
Stella_Comments: Why remove? I would call it "society" rather than "preferred_name" because it's the same as the society col on the culture metadata. But it seems useful to have. If keeping it, required should be TRUE.
Anna comments: Required and public, and remove “preferred” Society Name

name: Local_latitude

name: Local_longitude
Stella_Comments: Required should be TRUE

name: Homeland_longitude
description: Longitude of the homeland for diasporic societies

name: Preferred_name

name: Society_location
Stella_Comments: Don't remove! And make public. For field recordings, this is the recording location. For commerical recordings or other situations where the recording location doesn't represent the society, both are listed (e.g. Cairo, Egypt [Recorded in Canada]). This is where the lat-longs are derived from.

name: Audio_file
Anna comments: ID of audio file (T12240 , or T122R05, as we have it.)

name: archivalsource_id
description: Identification number of the archival source of the audio file
Stella_Comments: Structure varies by media type (LP or tape) and is sometimes inconsistent so I wouldn't specify a structure. These link to Lomax source materials so it seems best to keep true to the listed source id even if inconsistently formatted.
Pat comments: Maintain structure as is.  Rquired and internal
Anna comments: Maintain as is. Agree with Stella.  Require and internal.

name: Song
Stella_Comments: Required should be TRUE

name: Song_notes
description: Notes about the song recording. Details vary in length, but can range from the purpose of the song, to descriptions of instruments and how they are played, to what the song is about

name: Performers
description: Written description of the performers in the song

name: Instruments
description: Written description of the instruments used in the song

name: Lyrics
description: Lyrics of the song (sometimes with translation)

name: Living_metadata
Pat comments: Internal for the present. Will add to public later

name: Recorded_by
description: Name of who recorded the song

name: Source_tag
Stella_Comments: Again, maybe this should be public so users can look up the source in source database.
